comments.body: Excellent idea. I wish it had more votes.

For the meat pies they should be named as follows:

Cottage Pie= made from Beef
****Sheppard's Pie= made with Mutton (Finally giving mutton it own recipe!

These pies usually have mashed potatoes on top, so it would be really fun to give ðŸ¥” a new purpose aswell.

Sheppard Pie= egg, wheat, mutton, potato (or a baked potato!)

See my comment in the "More pies" post about giving dishes to villagers. These meat pies would fit well with either Farmers & Shepherds or Plains Biome Villagers.

I'm definitely not opposed to what you're saying 383276360032, however, I feel that because steak and porkchop are so common, porkchop should have a recipe of its own as well, and, to be honest, I can't help but find it funny if it turned out that mincemeat pies were among the things you could steal from illagers. 

Why?  Because if you found mincemeat pie at illager structures, as well as having the ability to craft it yourself, that means that one of the illagers secretly has a baking obsession but chances are high that the illager with the obsession wouldn't admit to it...  Who expects a burly warrior to have an obsession with something as domestic with baking?  Yet, in a weird way, it makes sense, especially when you think of the fact that Johnny kills just about everything he sees- including animals- and I'm pretty sure the other illagers regard Johnny as a bit of a nutcase, so there has to be a good reason why other illagers even tolerate his presence...

Meanwhile, things like Shepherd's Pie and Cottage Pie also make sense as villager trades...

Your idea is awesome, i was doing a roman city this month and i got a bit stuck when i tried to do merchant ships because there no way to do Amphoraes on minecraft, also they would be really useful.

 

I always throught minecraft would need a lot of pottery stuff like clay jars and stuff like that!
This could be great for new inventions!

I think an item that acts as a way to 'claim land' from monsters and players is a cool idea! It may need some attention on the player end of things; I mostly play solo so I'm not too sure what the implications of preventing others from placing/breaking blocks would be. Either way, this is a cool suggestion, with tons of detail, too. I'd like to see it get more attention!

I love this idea. Itâ€™s exactly what I was looking for when I was looking up totem poles. I myself feel creating yo own totem pole would be cool as we can create beacons, nether portals, and other structures to influence our world, but if we had to craft totem poles that would be cool to. I think totem poles could really add to the overall gameplay.

Me too :)
Bone meal and charcoal is way to cheap and unrealistic. It should be crafted with Blaze powder, coal and rotten flesh (to represent sulfur, coal and saltpeter).

The actual ingredients of gunpowder are charcoal, sulphur, and saltpeter.  Charcoal is already in the game. A brimstone block could be added to the basalt deltas that could be crafted (or better yet, ground with the grindstone) to create sulphur.  For saltpeter, maybe niter could be found in the new dripstone cave biomes being added.  The actual ratio is usually around 75% saltpeter, 15% charcoal, and 10% sulphur.  So maybe a shapeless 3x3 with 6 or 7 saltpeter/niter, 2 or 1 charcoal, and 1 sulphur, resulting in some number of gunpowder (should depend on how hard sulphur and saltpeter are to obtain).

-Hyrum_Graff (I can't change my name for some reason)

 

Thanks to YouTube user @colehan for the basalt deltas idea.  The best I could think of was something to do with netherrack.

I play with a custom behaviour mod of my own currently, the recipe is relatively easy to add, but I'd like to see the following added officially:

bone meal + flint + coal/charcoal = gunpowder

It's fun and makes mining more entertaining by exploding everything!
Acredito que uma boa receita possÃ­vel, Seria CarvÃ£o, Silex ou Farinha de osso e PÃ³ de Pedra luminosa ou PÃ³ de blaze.
10000% agree with the ingredients, could even use shells to get potassium nitrate, dripstone could be good to collect niter so in 9 blocks, 3 of charcoal, 4 shells, and 2 of sulfur
Along with sending items, certain items could change how the arrow works

Attaching splash potions would make a splash effect of the potion rather than only affecting if it hits the mob. The same goes for attaching lingering potions. Both arrows may be slower or not go as far as they are weighed down
Kind of useless, but you could attach eggs to arrows so you can shoot and hatch chickens farther. It could be good for pranks
Attached ender pearls could allow you to shoot the ender pearls farther

Attached Eyes of Ender could do a couple of interesting things. They could act like homing missiles, following the closest mob. They may not exactly follow the mob, just change direction slightly. They could also be returned to the user, making them reusable or like a boomerang
Attaching fireworks could make the arrow shoot straight until it runs out of power. It could also explode on impact. This may be redundant as you can already launch fireworks from crossbows
Using a Fishing Rod may allow you to shoot the fishing rod rather than just cast it (although this could just be a fishing rod enchantment)
Attaching redstone dust may give a redstone pulse. The closer you are may determine how powerful it is
Using a snowball may just make it so no damage is done. On the other hand, it could give the freezing effect
Using a Chorus Fruit may allow you to shoot Endermen. It could also make it so the mob can teleport out of the way of projectiles, although that could also be a new potion
Attaching a compass could make the arrow attracted to metal
Attaching a goat horn could play the raid sound everywhere the arrow flies. They could also give significant knockback
Attaching an Ink Sack may make the arrow slide even after it has hit something

I don't think you should attach milk buckets to arrows, but it would be cool if there was a sort of milk arrow that cured potion effects. I'm not entirely sure of that, because it falls into the same category as splash milk potions which I don't really like
Attaching music discs could play the song as they fly. It could be good for pranks. These could also be shot into jukeboxes
Attaching name tags may simply name the mob that is hit
Attaching shears would shear any mob or block that is hit
Attaching a Totem of Undying may stop the hit mob from dying
Attaching a fire charge may just make it a flaming arrow without having the flame enchantment. The same could go for adding blaze powder and coal
Adding a brick may cause knockback, stun mobs, and break blocks such as glass. You should also just be able to throw bricks by themselves
Adding a Copper Ingot may have a chance to summon lightning during a thunder storm
Adding gunpowder or tnt could make an exploding arrow, although personally I would just prefer it if there were dynamite sticks that could be thrown or launched in a cross/bow

Attaching slime balls would make the arrow bounce on blocks until it either runs out of momentum or it hits a mob, although it could still bounce off if it hits a mob. Magma cream would do the same but it may also give fire
Adding a phantom membrane may make it so it can pass through blocks. It may only affect slee deprived players. It could also track sleep deprived players
Attaching Banners may simply place banners where ever the arrow hits. I suppose all blocks could be attached and then shot to make builds, but I'm not sure I want that

Attaching a sponge may soak up any water around where it hits. This may be better if there was a sponge item along with a sponge block. This arrow may work well with Drowned, possibly turning them into zombies, and maybe zombies into husks
Add 8 leads to an arrow and hang a zip line across a cavern
@HeRains donâ€™t shulker boxes do most of that already?
Yes but it will be easier to make and does not place itself when killed
I don't think suitcases have wool on or in them. Also that would take out the point of the Shulker Box.
From my [age removed]: If you had a suitcase, you could take it on vacation so you have your stuff there.
cool but kinda pointless
This could be useful as a way to effectively stack potions.
